text: Dušan Trančík (born 26 November 1946) is a Slovak film director and screenwriter. He directed 22 films between 1968 and 1993. His 1991 film When the Stars Were Red was entered into the 41st Berlin International Film Festival. In 2012 he was granted funding for his next production The Donor. ==Selected filmography== * When the Stars Were Red (1991) ==References== ==External links== * Category:1946 births Category:Living people Category:Slovak film directors Category:Czechoslovak film directors Category:People from Bratislava
title: Dušan Trančík
